item.title: TANG√çVEIS ‚Äî Resid√™ncia AZ 2012
item.dc:creator: mm
item.description: A Audi√™ncia Zero vai realizar mais uma resid√™ncia art√≠stica multidisciplinar em O Espa√ßo do Tempo (Montemor-o-Novo), entre os dias 14 a 22 de Janeiro. Nesta edi√ß√£o, teremos uma novidade üôÇ Enquanto nas edi√ß√µes anteriores os participantes eram convidados a desenvolver qualquer tipo de projecto, individual ou colectivamente, nas √°reas de electr√≥nica, computa√ß√£o f√≠sica, instala√ß√µes … Continue reading "TANG√çVEIS ‚Äî Resid√™ncia AZ 2012"
item.content:encoded:
A Audi√™ncia Zero vai realizar mais uma resid√™ncia art√≠stica multidisciplinar em O Espa√ßo do Tempo (Montemor-o-Novo), entre os dias 14 a 22 de Janeiro.

Nesta edi√ß√£o, teremos uma novidade Enquanto nas edi√ß√µes anteriores os participantes eram convidados a desenvolver qualquer tipo de projecto, individual ou colectivamente, nas √°reas de electr√≥nica, computa√ß√£o f√≠sica, instala√ß√µes interactivas, etc., este ano propomos tamb√©m um objectivo comum: o desenvolvimento de interac√ß√µes tang√≠veis, atrav√©s da constru√ß√£o de objectos e espa√ßos interactivos capazes de demonstrar que um objecto pode causar interac√ß√µes distintas em espa√ßos distintos. A ideia √© fazer com que cada objecto a desenvolver interaja de forma diferenciada nos espa√ßos criados, ou que os objectos interajam entre eles pr√≥prios.

Deixamos aqui alguns exemplos de ideias a abordar.

Imagine um objecto a ser levado para determinado espa√ßo onde est√° uma luz robotizada. Quando o objecto √© ‚Äúreconhecido‚Äù no espa√ßo, a luz robotizada passa a seguir a pessoa que o carrega. Se o objecto for dado a outra pessoa, passa ent√£o ela a ser seguida pela luz.


√â poss√≠vel desenvolver outras interac√ß√µes semelhantes, por exemplo:

  • Ao apontar os objectos uns para os outros, os objectos reagem com som, luzes, etc.;
  • Ao alterar a sua posi√ß√£o no espa√ßo, o objecto reage com som, luzes, etc.;
  • Ao alterar a sua posi√ß√£o no espa√ßo, o objecto faz com que o espa√ßo reaja com projec√ß√µes de v√≠deo, som, luzes, etc.;
  • A mesma posi√ß√£o no espa√ßo pode causar interac√ß√µes diferentes com cada um dos objectos.

Podem ser desenvolvidas diversas narrativas ‚Äì art√≠sticas, did√°cticas, de ‚Äúgaming‚Äù, etc.

Para o desenvolvimento destes objectos e espa√ßos, prop√µem-se v√°rios tipos de tecnologias:

  • Electr√≥nica;
  • Computa√ß√£o F√≠sica;
  • Instala√ß√µes Interactivas;
  • Rob√≥tica;
  • Vis√£o por Computador;
  • Visualiza√ß√£o de Dados.

Ser√£o disponibilizados (a t√≠tulo de empr√©stimo) computadores, Ardu√≠nos, sensores e material electr√≥nico, projectores de v√≠deo, sistemas de √°udio, etc. para uso exlusivo no local da resid√™ncia e durante o per√≠odo de desenvolvimento dos projectos.

A resid√™ncia √© destinada aos actuais membros da rede AZ Labs ou a quem se identifique com o ojectivo proposto e tenha interesse em conhecer o trabalho por n√≥s desenvolvido. As vagas na resid√™ncia est√£o limitadas a 15.

Todos os participantes desfrutam de alojamento, pequeno almo√ßo e almo√ßo durante o per√≠odo da resid√™ncia.

Resid√™ncia AZ Janeiro 2012

Coordena√ß√£o: altLab ‚Äì Lisbon‚Äôs Hackerspace

Datas: 14 a 22 janeiro de 2012

Local: O Espa√ßo do Tempo (Montemor-o-Novo)

altlab.org

www.labcd.org

www.xdatelier.org

www.oespacodotempo.pt

[English]

 

Between 14 and 22 January 2012 O Espa√ßo do Tempo (Montemor-o-Novo) in collaboration with Audi√™ncia Zero is organizing another multi-disciplinary artistic residency.

During the previous editions the residents were invited to develop any kind of project, collectively or individually, in the areas of electronics, physical computation, interactive instalation, etc. In this edition we will have a new concept. We propose to develop projects with a common goal, tangible interaction, through the construction of objects and interactive spaces where the same object can interact in different ways. Or objects can interact among themselfs.

Here are a few example ideas, open for reuse.

Imagine an object being carried to a certain space where there is a robotized light source. When the object is recognized as entered the space the robotized light will follow the person carrying it. If the object is given to another person, they become the target of the light.

It‚Äôs possible to develop other similar interactions such as:

  • Pointing objects to one another, they react with sound, lights, etc
  • Changing an object position in space, the object reacts with sound, lights, etc.
  • Changing the object position in space, the object makes the space react with video projections, sound, lights, etc.
  • Same position in space can  cause different interactions with different obejcts.

Different narratives can be developed ‚Äî artistic, educational, gaming, etc.

For the developmnet of these objects and spaces, several technologies are proposed.

  • Electronics
  • Physical Computation
  • Interactive Installations
  • Robotics
  • Computer Vision
  • Data Visualization

The residency is open to current members of the AZ Labs network or anyone who identifies with the proposed objective. The residency is limited to 15 attenders only.

All participants have free lodging, breakfast and lunch during the residency period.

Resid√™ncia AZ Janeiro 2012

Coordination: altLab ‚Äì Lisbon‚Äôs Hackerspace

When: 14 ~ 22 january 2012

Where: O Espa√ßo do Tempo (Montemor-o-Novo)

www.altlab.org

www.labcd.org

www.xdatelier.org

www.oespacodotempo.pt

item.title: AZ Labs Colaborative Project Development Workshop
item.dc:creator: mm
item.description: [EN] Audi√™ncia Zero‚Äôs AZ Labs will be in residency at O Espa√ßo do Tempo in Montemor-o-Novo, Portugal, between 7 and 21 October 2011, to develop collaborative and multidisciplinary projects in Digital and Multimedia Art. The projects developed at this residency will be showcased publicly during 2011/2012 in several places in Portugal, with the first … Continue reading "AZ Labs Colaborative Project Development Workshop"
item.content:encoded:
[EN]

Audi√™ncia Zero‚Äôs AZ Labs will be in residency at O Espa√ßo do Tempo in Montemor-o-Novo, Portugal, between 7 and 21 October 2011, to develop collaborative and multidisciplinary projects in Digital and Multimedia Art.

The projects developed at this residency will be showcased publicly during 2011/2012 in several places in Portugal, with the first public showcase happening at Montemor-o-Novo during the week of 22 to 27 October 2011.

[PT]

Entre 7 e 21 de Outubro os laborat√≥rios da Audi√™ncia Zero v√£o estar em resid√™ncia n‚ÄôO Espa√ßo do Tempo, para desenvolver projectos colaborativos e multidisciplinares no dom√≠nio da arte digital e multim√©dia.

Desta resid√™ncia resultar√° uma mostra p√∫blica a apresentar em v√°rios pontos do pa√≠s, tendo a primeira exibi√ß√£o lugar logo na semana de 22 a 27 de Outubro, em Montemor-o-Novo.

 


Call for projects

[PT] Abaixo

[EN]

Open call for project proposals to be developed during the AZ Labs Residency at O Espa√ßo do Tempo (Montemor-o-Novo, Portugal) from 7 to 21 October 2011.

Up to 10 proposals will be selected, with a global financing of 25.000 euros. Production and financing for the residency is provided by O Espa√ßo do Tempo.

Projects

We seek project proposals to be developed during the residency period. Projects must be complete by the end of the residency period and ready for public showcasing during the week from 22 to 27 October.Project themes are open, with the only condition being that they should be related with the creative use of technology.

Some example project areas are:

  • Electronics and Physical Computing
  • Interactive Installations
  • Performance
  • Robotics
  • Computer Vision
  • Data Visualization

Project submission is a two stage process. On the first stage, authors should submit their project description through the project submission form on this website until June 12. On the second stage, project authors will be asked to make a public project presentation at the Pavilh√£o do Conhecimento in Lisbon in June 18 at 15:00.

Selected projects will be anounced until June 25.Projects submitted before the end of May will benefit from critical feedback from Audi√™ncia Zero, which authors may use to improve their projects presentation and technical description.

Residency

A total of 15 people will be selected to develop their projects at the residency, so project selection will take into account the number of people needed to develop the projects. O Espa√ßo do Tempo will provide lodging, breakfast and lunch for residents during project development and public showcase periods.

Financing

Authors of selected projects will receive a fixed artist fee of 1000 euro plus a variable budget for project development expenses.

Technical support

In the event that the authors lack the technical skills needed to develop the selected projects, Audi√™ncia Zero will issue a public call for project collaborators to assist in project development. Additionally all projects will receive technical support from Audi√™ncia Zero supervisors during the residency period.

Important Dates

  • Online proposal submission deadline: June 12 2011
  • Public proposal presentation: June 18 2011, Pavil√£o do Conhecimento (Lisbon, Portugal)
  • Selected projects announcement: June 25 2011
  • Residency: October 7‚Äì21 2011, O Espa√ßo do Tempo (Montemor-o-Novo, Portugal)
  • Public Showcase: October 22‚Äì27 2011, O Espa√ßo do Tempo (Montemor-o-Novo, Portugal)


[PT]

Chamada para apresenta√ß√£o de propostas de projectos a desenvolver durante a Resid√™ncia dos Laborat√≥rios AZ n‚ÄôO Espa√ßo do Tempo(Montemor-o-Novo) no per√≠odo entre 7 e 21 de Outubro de 2011.

Ser√£o seleccionadas at√© 10 propostas, sendo o financiamento global de 25.000euros. A produ√ß√£o e o financiamento da resid√™ncia s√£o da responsabilidade d‚ÄôO Espa√ßo do Tempo.

Projectos

Procuram-se propostas para desenvolvimento de projectos durante oper√≠odo de resid√™ncia. Os projectos ter√£o obrigatoriamente que estar terminados no final da resid√™ncia e prontos a ser mostrados ao p√∫blico na semana de 22 a 27 de Outubro.

A tem√°tica dos projectos √© livre, e a √∫nica condi√ß√£o √© relacionarem-se com uso criativo da tecnologia.

Exemplos de √°reas de projecto:

  • Electr√≥nica e Computa√ß√£o F√≠sica
  • Instala√ß√µes Interactivas
  • Performance
  • Rob√≥tica
  • Vis√£o por Computador
  • Visualiza√ß√£o de Dados

O processo de apresenta√ß√£o de projectos tem duas etapas. A primeira, at√© dia 12 de Junho, consiste no envio por formul√°rio pr√≥prio do projecto a ser desenvolvido. A segunda etapa ser√° uma apresenta√ß√£o p√∫blica no Pavilh√£o do Conhecimento, dia 18 de Junho, √†s 15h00.

Os projectos ser√£o seleccionados at√© dia 25 de Junho. Os projectos apresentados at√© final de Maio beneficiar√£o de um feedback cr√≠tico por parte da Audi√™ncia Zero, que os criadores poder√£o aproveitar para aperfei√ßoar a comunica√ß√£o do conceito do projecto, assim como a sua componente t√©cnica.

Resid√™ncia

A resid√™ncia tem um limite de 15 pessoas, estando a escolha dos projectos tamb√©m condicionada √† quantidade de pessoas necess√°ria para desenvolver o projecto em causa. O Espa√ßo do Tempo assegura alojamento, pequeno-almo√ßo e almo√ßo durante o per√≠odo de resid√™ncia e exposi√ß√£o.

Financiamento

Os projectos escolhidos para desenvolver na resid√™ncia ser√£o apoiadoscom um cachet de 1000 euros atribu√≠do ao criador, mais um valor vari√°vel para equipamento conforme as respectivas necessidades.

Apoio T√©cnico

Na eventualidade de haver falta de conhecimento t√©cnico para cumprir parte do projecto proposto, a Audi√™ncia Zero far√° um apelo a colaboradores externos que possam criar as condi√ß√µes necess√°rias ao seu desenvolvimento. Al√©m disso, todos os projectos contar√£o com a ajuda dos monitores da Audi√™ncia Zero durante o per√≠odo de resid√™ncia..

Datas importantes

  • Deadline Submiss√£o Propostas: 12 Junho 2011
  • Apresenta√ß√£o Propostas: 18 Junho 2011, Lisboa
  • Notifica√ß√£o dos projectos selecionados: 25 Junho 2011
  • Resid√™ncia: 7‚Äì21 Outubro 2011, Montemor-o-Novo (Espa√ßo do Tempo)
  • Primeira Exibi√ß√£o: 22‚Äì27 Outubro, Montemor-o-Novo (Espa√ßo do Tempo)

item.title: FabriCamp Lx1
item.dc:creator: mm
item.description: 3 de Abril de 2011 | April 3rd 2011 @ Pavilh√£o do Conhecimento [PT] √â com grande satisfa√ß√£o que a Rede de Laborat√≥rios da AZ (Associa√ß√£o Audi√™ncia Zero) anuncia o primeiro evento da FabriCulture: o FabriCamp Lx1! √â verdade, ser√° um dia inteiro ao estilo barcamp , dedicado √† fabrica√ß√£o digital. V√°rios membros e amigos … Continue reading "FabriCamp Lx1"
item.content:encoded:
3 de Abril de 2011 | April 3rd 2011 @ Pavilh√£o do Conhecimento

[PT]
√â com grande satisfa√ß√£o que a Rede de Laborat√≥rios da AZ (Associa√ß√£o Audi√™ncia Zero) anuncia o primeiro evento da FabriCulture: o FabriCamp Lx1!

√â verdade, ser√° um dia inteiro ao estilo barcamp , dedicado √† fabrica√ß√£o digital. V√°rios membros e amigos dos hackerspaces da AZ (LCD, altLab e xDA) ir√£o demonstrar as suas m√°quinas de prototipagem r√°pida, impressoras 3D e CNC Mills.
Caso tenha uma m√°quina para fabrica√ß√£o digital, seja de que tipo for, acabada, por acabar, avariada, etc., traga‚Äëa consigo. Ou ent√£o traga os amigos e a fam√≠lia (√© um evento tamb√©m para crian√ßas).

Photo by MakerBot Industries

Como em qualquer outro evento ao estilo barcamp, os participantes s√£o tamb√©m oradores; portanto est√£o todos convidados a fazer apresenta√ß√µes, lan√ßar debates, demonstrar os seus projectos, o que lhes apetecer.

A participa√ß√£o √© gratuita. Inscreva-se aqui.

A FabriCulture √© um projecto da AZ Labs Network dedicado √† promo√ß√£o do fabrico digital open source e da cultura maker em geral. Saiba mais sobre a FabriCulture aqui.

Se a revolu√ß√£o do fabrico digital √© para si novidade , vale a pena dar uma vista de olhos √† bela anima√ß√£o da NueveOjos Full Printed e √† apresenta√ß√£o Schuyler St. Ledger‚Äôs Ignite Phoenix .

[EN]
The AZ Labs Network is extremely happy to announce FabriCulture‚Äôs first event: FabriCamp Lx1! That‚Äôs right, it‚Äôll be a barcamp style unconference dedicated to digital fabrication. Several members and friends of AZ‚Äôs hackerspaces (LCD, altLab and xDA) will be demoing their 3D printers and CNC mills. If you have any kind of digital fabricator‚Äîfinished, unfinished, broken or so and so‚Äîbring it along. Or just bring yourself, your friends, your family (this is a children-friendly event). As in any other barcamp-style event, the attendees are also the speakers, so everyone is encouraged to give talks, start debates, demo their projects, lead workshops, whatever suits their fancy.

Participation is free. Please register here.

Fabriculture is an AZ Labs Network project dedicated to promoting open source digital fabrication and maker culture in general. Learn more about FabriCulture here.

For those new to the digital fabrication revolution make sure to also check out the beautiful Nueve Ojos Full Printed animation and Schuyler St. Ledger‚Äôs Ignite Phoenix presentation for a quick overview.

item.title: altLab‚Äôs new hacking facility
item.dc:creator: Reonarudo
item.description: This Tuesday Altlabs opened it‚Äôs new amazing hacking space. Now within an old planes suppling factory that was reconverted into the Flying House Lisboa a place that gathers music and urban artists. This new place gives AltLab a great new infrastructure and location filled with possibilities. Since it‚Äôs a heavily industrialized area we can only wonder what new resources and … Continue reading "altLab‚Äôs new hacking facility"
item.content:encoded:
This Tuesday Altlabs opened it‚Äôs new amazing hacking space. Now within an old planes suppling factory that was reconverted into the Flying House Lisboa a place that gathers music and urban artists.

This new place gives AltLab a great new infrastructure and location filled with possibilities. Since it‚Äôs a heavily industrialized area we can only wonder what new resources and contacts we will gather to continue improving AltLab as a Hackersapce.

The Flying House Lisboa includes a lounge area with a caf√© and small home restaurant on the second floor open to everyone on the building  and to AltLab‚Äôs members of course and a astonishing view over Lisbon‚Äôs airport.

Right on our first weekly meeting there we kicked off with a soft circuits workshop by Catarina, no one would be better to debut our new space that one of our dear founding members.

We even got time to finish assembling the Makerbot‚Äôs new rotating platform and extruder that we hope to have them ready to print as soon as possible.

As usual our door is wide open to everyone and we welcome all those lurking creative minds to bring great new ideas and projects to AltLab!

item.title: Arduino Hack Day report
item.dc:creator: mm
item.description: [PT]No √∫ltimo s√°bado, 5 de Fevereiro, o altlab organizou o Arduino Hack Day. Participaram no evento perto de 40 pessoas, entre entusiastas em electr√≥nica, artistas, programadores, arquitectos, fot√≥grafos, amigos. [EN]On Feb 5th altlab held its first Arduino Hack Day. Around 40 enthusiasts, artists, programmers, architects, photographers and friends participated in the event.   [PT]Para muitos, … Continue reading "Arduino Hack Day report"
item.content:encoded:
[PT]No √∫ltimo s√°bado, 5 de Fevereiro, o altlab organizou o Arduino Hack Day.
Participaram no evento perto de 40 pessoas, entre entusiastas em electr√≥nica, artistas, programadores, arquitectos, fot√≥grafos, amigos.
[EN]On Feb 5th altlab held its first Arduino Hack Day. Around 40 enthusiasts, artists, programmers, architects, photographers and friends participated in the event.

 

[PT]Para muitos, foi o primeiro contacto com o Arduino, a descoberta da simplicidade desta plataforma para o desenvolvimento de projectos de computa√ß√£o f√≠sica.
Distribu√≠dos por quatro bancadas, os participantes come√ßaram a experimentar assim que chegaram!
[EN]For many this was their first contact with the Arduino, discovering the ease with which this platform can be used for the development of physical computing projects.
Assembled around workbenches, participants started experimenting as soon as they arrived!

[PT]Uma das bancadas, dedicada ao tema Arduino, motores e a rob√≥tica, ficou por conta do Guilherme Martins (Guibot). Noutra bancada, alguns principiantes aprendiam a dar os primeiros passos, com a ajuda de membros do altlab.
[EN]One of the tables, dedicated to Arduino, motors and robotics, was run by Guilherme Martins (Guibot). Near by, at another table, some participants took their first steps with the help of altlab members.

[PT]Enquanto isso, a impressora 3D (‚Äúmakerbot‚Äù) trazida pelo nosso convidado neozeland√™s, Tiago, ia imprimindo as primeiras pe√ßas.
[EN]All the while, the MakerBot brought by our New Zeleand guest Tiago, was printing some plastic parts for the projects.

[PT]O Pedro √Çngelo, do LCDLab, veio do Porto para nos ajudar e ressuscitou um projecto antigo do Maur√≠cio, que depois de pronto gerou alguma divers√£o‚Ä¶
[EN]O Pedro √Çngelo, from LCDLab, came from Porto to help out and decided to bring back to life an old project of Maur√≠cio‚Äôs which immediately turned into a lot of fun.‚Ä¶

[PT]Logo depois do almo√ßo come√ßaram as apresenta√ß√µes. A M√≥nica Mendes e o Maur√≠cio Martins deram a conhecer o colectivo altlab, o seu passado, presente e futuro. A Cheng Xu, tamb√©m nossa convidada, apresentou-nos o Seeeduino Film. Por fim, o Guibot e o Andr√©, da Artica, falaram do Motoruino e do Farrusco.
[EN]After lunch we had some presentations. M√≥nica Mendes and Maur√≠cio Martins talked about the past, present and future of altlab. Our guest Cheng Xu presented the Seeduino film. Finally, Guibot and Andr√© from Artica talked about the Motoruino and Farrusco.

[PT]Passadas 10 horas de puro hacking e muita cerveja, o Arduino Hack Day chegava ao fim, todos os participantes muito satisfeitos com a experi√™ncia. O altlab conseguiu concretizar o principal objectivo desta iniciativa: juntar pessoas interessadas em partilhar conhecimentos sobre o Arduino, ajudar quem nunca tinha desenvolvido nada com a plataforma e conquistar novos interessados em pertencer a este colectivo fant√°stico!
[EN]After 10 hours of pure hacking and lots of beer, the Arduino Hack Day came to an end, and everyone left with a smile on their faces. We were able to attain the main goals for this event: gather people interested in sharing knowledge about the Arduino, help those who had never used the platform, and have several new members join our beloved collective.

[PT]Por √∫ltimo, fica aqui um agradecimento muito especial aos membros do altlab que contribu√≠ram na organiza√ß√£o deste evento:
[EN]Finally, a word of special thanks to the altlab members who contributed to making the Arduino Hack Day possible:

Andre Almeida, Ferdi Meier, Guilherme Martins, Leonardo Marques, Manuel Alves, Mauricio Martins, M√≥nica Mendes, Nuno Jo√£o, Paulo Rodrigues e Pedro √Çngelo (LCD).

Some photos by Jo√£o Nogueira e Rita Carvalho.

Flickr Photo Set: http://tinyurl.com/6f7vhsx

English version soon!

item.title: Soldering is Easy workshop report
item.dc:creator: mm
item.description: Terrific night yesterday @ altlab! The workshop started with an intro to electronics leaving the attendees anxious to get down to soldering. Despite that, everyone was focusing their attention on what was being said. Half an hour later the soldering irons were plugged in and the fun started. Hands-on and having fun! Blinking LED KIT … Continue reading "Soldering is Easy workshop report"
item.content:encoded:
Terrific night yesterday @ altlab!
The workshop started with an intro to electronics leaving the attendees anxious to get down to soldering.
Despite that, everyone was focusing their attention on what was being said.
Half an hour later the soldering irons were plugged in and the fun started.


Hands-on and having fun!


Blinking LED KIT


A new Hacker is born ! @Ricardo Castelhano


Here is the final result, everyone leaves with their own blinking gadget.

More photos @flickr

item.title: AZ ready for world domination
item.dc:creator: filipecruz
item.description: It took us a while, but practice makes perfect, and we‚Äôre now much closer to ridiculing Justin Bieber than we‚Äôve ever been before! You might have noticed what derived from our Residency @ Espa√ßo do Tempo, a dozen projects from several folks spread over the 3 labs exploring the robotic, the interactive, the sensorial, the … Continue reading "AZ ready for world domination"
item.content:encoded:
It took us a while, but practice makes perfect, and we‚Äôre now much closer to ridiculing Justin Bieber than we‚Äôve ever been before!

You might have noticed what derived from our Residency @ Espa√ßo do Tempo, a dozen projects from several folks spread over the 3 labs exploring the robotic, the interactive, the sensorial, the tangible, the generative, the audiovisual, the augmented, the provocative, the performative and a few other of all those dirty little words you so much secretly love hearing about. Don‚Äôt be shy now. Nothing wrong with getting a little tangible now and again.

We even participated in a little exhibit last month at Pavilh√£o Atl√¢ntico to present these and a couple other works. And now we‚Äôre back with more weapons of mass destruction. And now, this very weekend we‚Äôre meeting up again for some holiday hacking follery at LCD to show some more of our projects and do a few mini-sprints. Feel free to join us. Lock up your geeks, we‚Äôre coming for them!

And if all this wasn‚Äôt good enough to turn you on and make you come down to meet us and participate, allow me to break some further news to you. Two of our projects have recently received their due acknowledgement by two of the highest distinctions in these parts:

  • ‚ÄúAmong‚Äù By S√©rgio Ferreira et al won Fundacion Telefonica‚Äôs VIDA competition, read all about it in the news (.pt only) and the interview.
  • ‚ÄúBig Brother Goes Green: Surveillance for Sustainable Forests‚Äù by M√≥nica Mendes et al was approved at South By SouthWest.

And just in case you recognize the lab affiliations from the above and feel like xDA is slacking off compared to our counterparts: we‚Äôre not, we got multitouch interfaces.

And if you‚Äôve read this far, please make some tea and have yourself a Bieber moment in a cube. You‚Äôre welcome.

item.title: AZLabs @ O Espa√ßo do Tempo
item.dc:creator: filipecruz
item.description: After many days of work, stress and fun, we seem to have managed to pull through 10 projects to showcase at O Espa√ßo do Tempo! The exhibition opened yesterday, 12th July at Convento da Sauda√ß√£o and will remain in exhibit until the end of the month. We also have a mini-site with bios of the … Continue reading "AZLabs @ O Espa√ßo do Tempo"
item.content:encoded:
After many days of work, stress and fun, we seem to have managed to pull through 10 projects to showcase at O Espa√ßo do Tempo! The exhibition opened yesterday, 12th July at Convento da Sauda√ß√£o and will remain in exhibit until the end of the month.

We also have a mini-site with bios of the authors and descriptions of the works, temporarily hosted here. Not only of the works present at the exhibition but also a few others developed during the residency that couldn‚Äôt be exhibited by one reason or another. Check them out!

Big thanks are in order to everyone at O Espa√ßo do Tempo for the opportunity we had, and all the in loco support to our needs, you rock.

item.content:encoded:
2 days to go until the exhibit opening of the Audiencia Zero Labs residency at O Espa√ßo Do Tempo!

A few folks seem to be missing in action. Mauricio is back with some news from Interactivos to lend us a hand on pending projects. M√≥nica and Pedro are still working on B‚Äëwind!. Margarida working on his robot Freddy. Victor Silva rehearsing his The Last Words of Dominico. Victor and Marco working on Discardable Beauty. Guilherme finishing his R√≥botica Criativa works. And me finishing up Meta Gen Haiku. Catarina and Joel should also show up tomorow with their Micro D√©rive.

Website with more info on the presented projects should go online soon. In the meantime if you should show up on Monday the 12th July in Montemor-O-Novo for the exhibit. We will have 7 projects installed under exhibition until the 31st July, and 2 liveacts presented on the exhibition day 12th July.

In the meantime we‚Äôll leave you with some important t‚Äëshirt quote material we have recently acquired:
‚Äú48 horas s√£o 6 dias de trabalho, em turnos de 8 horas‚Äù
‚ÄúEu s√≥ fa√ßo projection mapping quando estou b√™bado‚Äù
‚ÄúN√£o tens pincel para isso. Vai antes de rolo.‚Äù
‚ÄúQueres falar ao telefone? Fala a√≠! *slap*‚Äù

item.title: AZ Labs Exhibition @ O Espa√ßo do Tempo
item.dc:creator: Catarina M.
item.description: LCD + AltLab + xDA 12 ‚Äî 31 July 2010 Convento da Sauda√ß√£o | Montemor-o-Novo | Portugal Exhibition: Monday to Friday ‚Äî 6pm / 11pm | Saturday and Sunday ‚Äî 4pm /11pm Opening: 12th of July, 18h00 Artists : Catarina Mota | Filipe Cruz | Francesco Cerutti | Guilherme Martins | Jo√£o Maia e Silva … Continue reading "AZ Labs Exhibition @ O Espa√ßo do Tempo"
item.content:encoded:
LCD + AltLab + xDA
12 ‚Äî 31 July 2010
Convento da Sauda√ß√£o | Montemor-o-Novo | Portugal

Exhibition: Monday to Friday ‚Äî 6pm / 11pm | Saturday and Sunday ‚Äî 4pm /11pm
Opening: 12th of July, 18h00

Artists : Catarina Mota | Filipe Cruz | Francesco Cerutti | Guilherme Martins | Jo√£o Maia e Silva | Jo√´l Belouet | Jorge Ribeiro | Pedro √Çngelo | Margarida Faria | Maur√≠cio Martins | M√≥nica Mendes | Marco Moura | Mariana Ferreira | M√©cia S√° | Ricardo Webbens | S√©rgio Ferreira | Tiago Serra | Vitor Lago Silva | Victor Martins

This exhibition presents the results of a unique experiment. For 17 days, 30 members of the Audiencia Zero Labs from all over the country and also abroad lived and worked together on collective projects. New teams were formed, infinite ideas proposed, new tools and technologies experimented with, incredible adventures lived and new friends made. The projects at this exhibit are just the tip of the veil, the true impact of this experience is yet to come.

More info @ O Espa√ßo do Tempo
